      • signalCB1

        public void signalCB1()
        CB1 is an input interrupt line that can then send an IRQ to the CPU. Plain test.

      • signalCB1onHighToLow

        public void signalCB1onHighToLow()
        Test that the interrupt happens on high-to-low transition.

      • signalCB1onLowToHigh

        public void signalCB1onLowToHigh()
        Test that the interrupt happens on low-to-high transition. Low-to-high if bit 1 is true.

      • signalCB1withBlockedIRQ

        public void signalCB1withBlockedIRQ()
        Block interrupts, and send signal to interrupt line. Then turn on interrupts.

      • signalCB2withBlockedIRQ

        public void signalCB2withBlockedIRQ()
        Block interrupts, and send signal to interrupt line. Then turn on interrupts.

      • useCA2asOutput

        public void useCA2asOutput()
        Use CA2 as output when CA1 goes high. CA2 goes low when reading output register A.

      • useCA2asPlainPin

        public void useCA2asPlainPin()
        Use CA2 as plain output line. This happens when bit 4 is high.
